newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE sugar finishes at lows after failing upside.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE sugar finishes at lows after failing upside.

text.p: Nearby LIFFE white sugar futures ended weaker after losses in the New York raws market helped to puncture confidence, traders said.
The spot March contract finished the day at its low of $297.80 per tonne, a loss of $2.00, after earlier probing resistance of $300.
A disappointing New York performance prompted commission house selling into the earlier strength from trade buying.
May closed at its low of $297.50, down $1.90. Overall volume was 1,351 lots.
In Paris, March ended $1.00 down at $299.00 and May was 50 cents off at $298.50.
